option.a: the linear speed is the product of the angular speed and the radius or amplitude
option.b: the linear acceleration is the product of the square of the angular speed and the displacement
option.c: frequency is the number of complete revolution per second made by a vibrating body
option.d: the S.I unit of amplitude is Hertz (Hz)

data.question: An air bubble at the bottom of a lake has a volume of 20cm3, pressure of 4.9Pa, and temperature 4oc the bubble rises to the surface where the temperature is 20oc and the pressure 1.0Pa. Find the volume as the bubble reaches the surface. (take 1 atm = 1.0 x 105 N/m2)

An object is said to be in simple harmonic motion (SHM) if

option.a: the acceleration is directly proportional to the displacement and is directed towards the equilibrium position of the object.
option.b: the acceleration is inversely proportional to the displacement and directed toward the equilibrium position  of the object
option.c: the displacement is directly proportional  to the momentum  and directed toward the equilibrium position of  the object
option.d: the momentum is directly proportional to the displacement and directed toward the equilibrium position of the object.

option.a: the horn of a motor car

data.question: A coil of copper wire of N turns is kept rotating between the poles of a magnet  such that the magnetic flux linking the coil changes continuously. Which of the  following statements is TRUE?

option.a: An e.m.f is induced in the coil such that when  the change of flux is positive the e.m.f is positive, and when the change of flux is negative the e.m.f is negative.
option.b: An e.m.f is induced in the coil whose magnitude  is inversely proportional to both the number of turns in the coil and the rate of  change of magnetic flux
option.c: . An e.m.f is set up in the permanent magnet which  reduces the flux in the coil to zero
option.d: A current flows in the coil and e.m.f is set  up proportional to both the rate of change of the flux and the number of turns

option.d: is not affected by the altitude

data.question: If two masses 40g and 60g respectively, are attached firmly to end of a light metre rule, what is the centre of gravity of the system?

option.a: at the mid point of the metre rule

Three knives made of steel, plastic and flat wood respectively are placed on the table for an equal amount of time. The steel knife feels coldest to touched because

option.a: The steel knife has the lowest temperature
option.b: The plastic and wooden knives have absorbed more heat from the environment than the steel knife.
option.c: Both wooden and plastic knives have lower densities than the steel
option.d: The steel knife conducts heat faster from the finger than the wooden and plastic knives

data.question: Which of the following statements is not true?

option.a: electric field intensity is force per unit charge.
option.c: the S.I unit of electric field strength is N/C
option.d: electric field intensity is equal to the potential gradient

data.question: To convert an a.c generator to d.c generator, one needs to

option.a: Remove the brush touching the slip rings
option.c: Replace the permanent magnets with  iron-core armature.
option.d: replace the slip rings with split rings
